intro: Meconopsis baileyi subsp. multidentata, commonly known as the Himalayan blue poppy, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of the Himalayas. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet petals and is part of the Papaveraceae family. The plant typically grows in rocky and moist environments at high elevations. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture. Meconopsis baileyi subsp. multidentata is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
